work.position: Advisor to Raytheon SAS Software Center Managment
work.summary: Worked with the top management of the Sofware Engineering center to improve talent acquisition and retention
highlights: Added an emphasis on hiring people with hardware and software experience for test and measurement software roles
Expanded the duration of on site interviews and greatly expanded their technical scope
Added an emphasis on system level skills for test and measurement software roles, as the quick turn nature of the work demands it
Organized an effort to ensure that new hires would have interesting work from day 1, to improve morale.
Peformed resume screening, phone screening, and on site interviews to assist in implementing these hiring changes

work.summary: VIIRS is a spaceborn sensor that provides multispectral radiometric imaging of the earth for weather prediction purposes. Prior to integration onto a spacecraft it undergoes a long intensive test in simulated environments and using a simulation of the spacecraft and ground station that control it. I was the product owner for the ground station and spacecraft simulators (ESTE), in both hardware and software. In this role I undertook a large number of upgrades and improvements, both driven by customer needs and changing program requirements.
highlights: Pushed for and lead a complete redesign and rewrite of the core software of the ESTE
Made an adapter board to allow the use of cheap COTS communications boards in place of the expensive custom ones
Redesigned the ESTE to support SpaceWire connectivity to support VIIRS upgrades

Designed, built, and maintained an automated data aggregation and transfer system that provided Analysts with test data within 5 minutes of collection, a vast improvement over the several hours of manual work it took previously

work.position: Optical Test Station Electrical and Software Architect

awards.title: Innovation Award
awards.summary: Award for a novel configuration database scheme for a test station
